concept.title: Settings
concept.shortdesc: The Settings view gives access to the following console and system settings:

dlentry.dd: Sets the verbosity of logs from debug2 (most verbose) through off (silent)
Sets the email address displayed to application developers when errors are encounteredUse an email address monitored by administrators.
Sets the URIs for App Store Definition YAML files which populate the App Store (the URIs do not have to be public, but must be accessible from the controller node)
Limits Docker image deployment to organizations with sudo permissions enabled in the quota plan

Allows users to deploy Docker images from any registry server Docker image deployment should be limited to either a trusted group of users, trusted image sources, or both. Allowing any user to deploy Docker images without restrictions is not recommended.

dd.p: Displays a list of servers, namespaces, or images that users are allowed to deploy. Entries are specified in the standard format accepted by the docker client: <username>:<password>@<domain>:<port>/<namespace>/<repo>:<tag>

ul.li: the library/httpd repo on the Docker Hub
Docker Hub repos under the cloudfoundry namespace

row.entry: any namespace, repo, or tag in a private registry
any repo in the library namespace

ul.li: any repo in the prod namespace

row.entry: a registry server running on a specific port

dd.note: When a user requests a matching image name without credentials, credentials specified in the Allowed Docker Registries list are used by default.

dlentry.dd: Sets the Debian package repositories allowed in application containers. Application developers can install additional packages (using apt-get or aptitude) only from these repositories. When adding new repositories, GPG keys for each new repo must also be added to the Docker base container (see Allowed Repositories).

dd.p: Shuts down API requests but continues to serve web requests (this is useful for performing system operations such as importing and exporting data for upgrades). When the primary node enters maintenance mode, the Management Console becomes read-only with the exception of this toggle (which allows it to be brought back online)

dlentry.dd: Sets virtual hostnames reserved for use by the system which cannot be used for applications. This setting prevents application developers from deploying applications on URIs required by the system (for example, api). It can also be used when a particular DNS sub-domain record is not being resolved to the system. Specify only the host (subdomain) portion of the URI. Fully-qualified URLs will be ignored.

section.p: Settings and templates that allow you to customize the look and feel of the Management Console. These settings are divided into the following categories:

dlentry.dd: Sets the options to rename and reversion for OEM deployments, change the default locale (currently only en and de are available), choose a different URL for documentation, or disable console pingbacks
Sets the version number setting and alternative paths or URLs for alternative or renamed CLI clients
Sets the favicon, header, footer, or background color
Sets the EJS-templated HTML for displaying on the Welcome view
Sets the EJS-templated HTML for displaying on the Support view. Change this setting if you support your application developers directly.
Sets the End User License Agreement. Change this setting only if you are an OEM customer exposing to application developers under your own specific licensing terms

Sets the single CSS file used to override any existing styling in the Management Console Inspect the Console with browser tools such as Firebug or Chrome Developer Tools to see the class names and IDs

section.note: For detailed instructions on customizing and branding , see Theming and Customization.

dlentry.dd: Sets the percentage of physical memory that each DEA node can use for hosted applications. The 80% default setting leaves enough memory for the operating system and DEA processes on a node with 4 GB of RAM. This setting can be increased on nodes that have more memory available (for example, to 90% on a node with 8 GB of RAM). Restart all DEA roles and nodes to apply your change.Do not exceed 100% unless the system correctly supports swap space and has it enabled.
Sets the maximum time allowed for application staging
Displays a filterable list of DEA Placement Zones on the
Displays a filterable list of Availability Zones on the

section.p: Administrators can use feature flags to toggle specific permissions that allow organization managers and developers to perform certain tasks. When the feature flag is disabled, only an administrator can perform the task.

dlentry.dd: Allows developers to upload application bits (enabled by default)
Allows developers to scale applications (enabled by default)
Allows organization managers to create private domains for that organization (enabled by default)
Allows developers to create routes in a space (enabled by default)
Allows developers to create service instances in a space (enabled by default)
Allows any user to create an organization via the API (disabled by default)

section.p: These options can also be toggled using the CLI client with the feature flags commands.

dlentry.dd: Sets the maximum number of service slots to allocate
Sets the maximum size on disk for filesystem services (in MB)
Ignores the Capacity setting

section.p: Settings for the Harbor TCP/UDP port service.

dd.p: Sets the public IP (if configured) for the Harbor node

dlentry.dd: Sets the public hostname for the Harbor node
Sets the minimum for the exposed port range (the default is 35000)
Sets the maximum for the exposed port range (the default is 40000)

section.note: For more information, see Harbor: Requirements & Setup.

dlentry.dd: Ignores the Capacity setting
Sets the maximum number of service slots to allocate
Sets the maximum size on disk to allocate for database services
Sets the maximum amount of physical memory to allocate to the service
Sets the maximum amount of physical memory to allocate for memcached instances
Sets the maximum size on disk for filesystem services
